speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What, have I ’scaped love letters in

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: the holiday time of my beauty, and am I now a

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: subject for them? Let me see.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What a Herod of Jewry is this! O wicked, wicked

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: world! One that is well-nigh worn to pieces with

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: age, to show himself a young gallant! What an

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: unweighed behavior hath this Flemish drunkard

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: picked—with the devil’s name!—out of my conversation,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: that he dares in this manner assay me?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Why, he hath not been thrice in my company!

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What should I say to him? I was then frugal of my

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: mirth. Heaven forgive me! Why, I’ll exhibit a bill

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: in the Parliament for the putting down of men.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: How shall I be revenged on him? For revenged I

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: will be, as sure as his guts are made of puddings.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Mistress Page! Trust me, I was going to

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: your house.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: And, trust me, I was coming to you.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: You look very ill.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Nay, I’ll ne’er believe that. I have to

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: show to the contrary.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Faith, but you do, in my mind.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Well, I do, then. Yet I say I could show

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: you to the contrary. O Mistress Page, give me some

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: counsel.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What’s the matter, woman?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: O woman, if it were not for one trifling

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: respect, I could come to such honor!

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Hang the trifle, woman; take the honor.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What is it? Dispense with trifles. What is it?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: If I would but go to hell for an eternal

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: moment or so, I could be knighted.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What, thou liest! Sir Alice Ford? These

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: knights will hack, and so thou shouldst not alter

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: the article of thy gentry.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: We burn daylight. Here, read, read. Perceive

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: how I might be knighted.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: I shall think the

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: worse of fat men as long as I have an eye to make

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: difference of men’s liking. And yet he would not

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: swear; praised women’s modesty; and gave such

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: orderly and well-behaved reproof to all uncomeliness

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: that I would have sworn his disposition

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: would have gone to the truth of his words. But

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: they do no more adhere and keep place together

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: than the Hundredth Psalm to the tune of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: “Greensleeves.“ What tempest, I trow, threw this

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: whale, with so many tuns of oil in his belly, ashore

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: at Windsor? How shall I be revenged on him? I

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: think the best way were to entertain him with hope

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: till the wicked fire of lust have melted him in his

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: own grease. Did you ever hear the like?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Letter for letter, but that the name of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Page and Ford differs! To thy great comfort in this

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: mystery of ill opinions, here’s the twin brother of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: thy letter.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: But let thine inherit first, for I protest

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: mine never shall. I warrant he hath a thousand of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: these letters writ with blank space for different

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: names—sure, more—and these are of the second

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: edition. He will print them, out of doubt; for he

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: cares not what he puts into the press, when he

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: would put us two. I had rather be a giantess and lie

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: under Mount Pelion. Well, I will find you twenty

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: lascivious turtles ere one chaste man.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Why, this is the very same—the very

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: hand, the very words. What doth he think of us?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Nay, I know not. It makes me almost

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: ready to wrangle with mine own honesty. I’ll entertain

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: myself like one that I am not acquainted

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: withal; for, sure, unless he know some strain in

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: me that I know not myself, he would never have

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: boarded me in this fury.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: “Boarding” call you it? I’ll be sure to

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: keep him above deck.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: So will I. If he come under my hatches,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: I’ll never to sea again. Let’s be revenged on him.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Let’s appoint him a meeting, give him a show of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: comfort in his suit, and lead him on with a fine-baited

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: delay till he hath pawned his horses to mine

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Host of the Garter.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Nay, I will consent to act any villainy

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: against him that may not sully the chariness of our

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: honesty. O, that my husband saw this letter! It

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: would give eternal food to his jealousy.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Why, look where he comes, and my

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: good man too. He’s as far from jealousy as I am

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: from giving him cause, and that, I hope, is an

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: unmeasurable distance.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: You are the happier woman.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Let’s consult together against this greasy

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: knight. Come hither.

speaker: FORD
text: Well, I hope it be not so.

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Hope
               
              is
               
              a
               
              curtal
               
              dog
               
              in
               
              some
               
              affairs
              .

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Sir
               
              John
               
              affects
               
              thy
               
              wife
              .

speaker: FORD
text: Why, sir, my wife is not young.

speaker: PISTOL
text:
He
               
              woos
               
              both
               
              high
               
              and
               
              low
              ,
               
              both
               
              rich
               
              and
               
              poor
              ,

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Both
               
              young
               
              and
               
              old
              ,
               
              one
               
              with
               
              another
              ,
               
              Ford
              .

speaker: PISTOL
text:
He
               
              loves
               
              the
               
              gallimaufry
              .
               
              Ford
              ,
               
              perpend
              .

speaker: FORD
text: Love my wife?

speaker: PISTOL
text:
With
               
              liver
               
              burning
               
              hot
              .
               
              Prevent
              ,

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Or
               
              go
               
              thou
               
              like
               
              Sir
               
              Acteon
              ,
               
              he
              ,

speaker: PISTOL
text:
With
               
              Ringwood
               
              at
               
              thy
               
              heels
              .

speaker: PISTOL
text:
O
              ,
               
              odious
               
              is
               
              the
               
              name
              !

speaker: FORD
text: What name, sir?

speaker: PISTOL
text: The horn, I say. Farewell.

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Take
               
              heed
              ,
               
              have
               
              open
               
              eye
              ,
               
              for
               
              thieves
               
              do
               
              foot
               
              by
               
              night
              .

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Take
               
              heed
              ,
               
              ere
               
              summer
               
              comes
               
              or
               
              cuckoo
               
              birds
               
              do
               
              sing
              .
              —

speaker: PISTOL
text: Away, Sir Corporal Nym.—Believe it, Page. He

speaker: PISTOL
text: speaks sense.

speaker: FORD
text: I will be patient. I will find out this.

speaker: NYM
text: And this is true. I like not the humor of

speaker: NYM
text: lying. He hath wronged me in some humors. I

speaker: NYM
text: should have borne the humored letter to her; but I

speaker: NYM
text: have a sword, and it shall bite upon my necessity.

speaker: NYM
text: He loves your wife; there’s the short and the long.

speaker: NYM
text: My name is Corporal Nym. I speak and I avouch.

speaker: NYM
text: ’Tis true. My name is Nym, and Falstaff loves your

speaker: NYM
text: wife. Adieu. I love not the humor of bread and

speaker: NYM
text: cheese. Adieu.

speaker: PAGE
text: “The humor of it,” quoth he? Here’s a fellow

speaker: PAGE
text: frights English out of his wits.

speaker: FORD
text: I will seek out Falstaff.

speaker: PAGE
text: I never heard such a drawling, affecting

speaker: PAGE
text: rogue.

speaker: FORD
text: If I do find it—well.

speaker: PAGE
text: I will not believe such a Cataian, though

speaker: PAGE
text: the priest o’ th’ town commended him for a true

speaker: PAGE
text: man.

speaker: FORD
text: ’Twas a good sensible fellow—well.

speaker: PAGE
text: How now, Meg?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Whither go you, George? Hark you.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: How now, sweet Frank? Why

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: art thou melancholy?

speaker: FORD
text: I melancholy? I am not melancholy. Get you

speaker: FORD
text: home. Go.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Faith, thou hast some crochets in thy

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: head now.—Will you go, Mistress Page?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Have with you.—You’ll come to dinner,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
George?
                 
                (
                Aside
                 
                to
                 
                Mistress
                 
                Ford
                .
                )
               Look who

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: comes yonder.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: She shall be our messenger to this paltry knight.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Trust me, I thought on her. She’ll fit it.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: You are come to

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: see my daughter Anne?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              QUICKLY
text: Ay, forsooth. And, I pray, how does

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              QUICKLY
text: good Mistress Anne?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Go in with us and see. We have an

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: hour’s talk with you.

speaker: PAGE
text: How now, Master Ford?

speaker: FORD
text: You heard what this knave told me, did you not?

speaker: PAGE
text: Yes, and you heard what the other told me?

speaker: FORD
text: Do you think there is truth in them?

speaker: PAGE
text: Hang ’em, slaves! I do not think the knight

speaker: PAGE
text: would offer it. But these that accuse him in his intent

speaker: PAGE
text: towards our wives are a yoke of his discarded

speaker: PAGE
text: men, very rogues, now they be out of service.

speaker: FORD
text: Were they his men?

speaker: PAGE
text: Marry, were they.

speaker: FORD
text: I like it never the better for that. Does he lie at

speaker: FORD
text: the Garter?

speaker: PAGE
text: Ay, marry, does he. If he should intend this voyage

speaker: PAGE
text: toward my wife, I would turn her loose to him;

speaker: PAGE
text: and what he gets more of her than sharp words, let

speaker: PAGE
text: it lie on my head.

speaker: FORD
text: I do not misdoubt my wife, but I would be loath

speaker: FORD
text: to turn them together. A man may be too confident.

speaker: FORD
text: I would have nothing lie on my head. I cannot

speaker: FORD
text: be thus satisfied.

speaker: PAGE
text: Look where my ranting Host of the Garter

speaker: PAGE
text: comes. There is either liquor in his pate or money

speaker: PAGE
text: in his purse when he looks so merrily.—How now,

speaker: PAGE
text: mine Host?

speaker: HOST
text: How now, bullyrook? Thou ’rt a gentleman.—

speaker: HOST
text: Cavaleiro Justice, I say!

speaker: SHALLOW
text: I follow, mine Host, I follow.—Good even

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and twenty, good Master Page. Master Page, will

speaker: SHALLOW
text: you go with us? We have sport in hand.

speaker: HOST
text: Tell him, Cavaleiro Justice; tell him, bullyrook.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir, there is a fray to be fought between

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir Hugh the Welsh priest and Caius the French

speaker: SHALLOW
text: doctor.

speaker: FORD
text: Good mine Host o’ th’ Garter, a word with you.

speaker: HOST
text: What say’st thou, my bullyrook?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Will you go with us to behold it?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: My merry Host hath had the measuring of their

speaker: SHALLOW
text: weapons and, I think, hath appointed them contrary

speaker: SHALLOW
text: places; for, believe me, I hear the parson is no

speaker: SHALLOW
text: jester. Hark, I will tell you what our sport shall be.

speaker: HOST
text: Hast thou no suit against my knight,

speaker: HOST
text: my guest cavalier?

speaker: FORD
text: None, I protest. But I’ll give you a pottle of

speaker: FORD
text: burnt sack to give me recourse to him, and tell him

speaker: FORD
text: my name is Brook—only for a jest.

speaker: HOST
text: My hand, bully. Thou shalt have egress and

speaker: HOST
text: regress—said I well?—and thy name shall be

speaker: HOST
text: Brook. It is a merry knight.

speaker: HOST
text: Will you go, ameers?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Have with you, mine Host.

speaker: PAGE
text: I have heard the Frenchman hath good skill

speaker: PAGE
text: in his rapier.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Tut, sir, I could have told you more. In these

speaker: SHALLOW
text: times you stand on distance—your passes, stoccados,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and I know not what. ’Tis the heart, Master

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Page; ’tis here, ’tis here. I have seen the time, with

speaker: SHALLOW
text: my long sword I would have made you four tall

speaker: SHALLOW
text: fellows skip like rats.

speaker: HOST
text: Here, boys, here, here! Shall we wag?

speaker: PAGE
text: Have with you. I had rather hear them scold

speaker: PAGE
text: than fight.

speaker: FORD
text: Though Page be a secure fool and stands so

speaker: FORD
text: firmly on his wife’s frailty, yet I cannot put off my

speaker: FORD
text: opinion so easily. She was in his company at Page’s

speaker: FORD
text: house, and what they made there I know not. Well,

speaker: FORD
text: I will look further into ’t, and I have a disguise to

speaker: FORD
text: sound Falstaff. If I find her honest, I lose not my

speaker: FORD
text: labor. If she be otherwise, ’tis labor well bestowed.
